clinical_study.brief_title: The Multifunctional Image Guided Therapy Suite (MIGTS) in Emergency Multiple Trauma Care
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of a Multifunctional Image Guided Therapy Suite (MIGTS) on Emergency Multiple Trauma Care - a Controlled Clinical Pilot Study

collaborator.agency: Scientific Foundation of the Swiss Accident Insurance Fond

brief_summary.textblock: Controlled clinical intervention study comparing the treatment of multiple trauma patients in a newly developed combined diagnostic and operation room, the multifunctional image guided therapy suite (MIGTS) versus controls. The MIGTS proved to significantly accelerate the procedure and led to more satisfied team members.

detailed_description.textblock:
Objective: Pilot evaluation to which extend the implementation of a newly developed combined diagnostic and operation room, the multifunctional image guided therapy suite (MIGTS) may influence the emergency treatment of multiply injured patients.
Summary Background: Controlled data on the impact of modern technology integration in multiple trauma management and involved care providers are lacking.
Methods: Quasi-randomized clinical intervention study comparing the treatment of multiple trauma patients (injury severity score, ISS >16) in the MIGTS versus controls.

primary_outcome.time_frame: first CT scan after arrival of emergency patient

secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of emergency treatment (arrival ICU or death)

clinical_study.condition: Reduction of Number of Transports and Transfers

arm_group.description: controlled trial (quasi-randomized) versus controls (=conventional treatment not in the MIGTS)

arm_group.arm_group_label: controls (=conventional treatment not in the MIGTS)

intervention.description: treatment of multiple trauma patients in the MIGTS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- multiple trauma with
- at least two abbreviated injury scoring (AIS) regions involved and
- injury severity score (ISS)>16
- primary hospital treatment at University Hospital Basel
Exclusion Criteria:
- monotrauma or
- ISS < 16 or
- prior treatment in another hospital
